classification.description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as sulfinylbenzimidazoles. These are polycyclic aromatic compounds containing a sulfinyl group attached at the position 2 of a benzimidazole moiety.

category.category: Drugs for Peptic Ulcer and Gastro-Oesophageal Reflux Disease (Gord)

atc-code.level: DRUGS FOR PEPTIC ULCER AND GASTRO-OESOPHAGEAL REFLUX DISEASE (GORD)

drug-interaction.name: Dabrafenib
drug-interaction.description: The serum concentration of Dexrabeprazole can be decreased when it is combined with Dabrafenib.

drug-interaction.name: Amphetamine
drug-interaction.description: Dexrabeprazole can cause an increase in the absorption of Amphetamine resulting in an increased serum concentration and potentially a worsening of adverse effects.

drug-interaction.name: Bosutinib
drug-interaction.description: Dexrabeprazole can cause a decrease in the absorption of Bosutinib resulting in a reduced serum concentration and potentially a decrease in efficacy.

article.citation: Lee SJ: Clinical Application of CYP2C19 Pharmacogenetics Toward More Personalized Medicine. Front Genet. 2013 Feb 1;3:318. doi: 10.3389/fgene.2012.00318. eCollection 2012.

attachment.title: Acid peptic diseases: pharmacological approach to treatment

polypeptide.name: Cytochrome P450 2C19
polypeptide.specific-function: Responsible for the metabolism of a number of therapeutic agents such as the anticonvulsant drug S-mephenytoin, omeprazole, proguanil, certain barbiturates, diazepam, propranolol, citalopram and imipramine.

go-classifier.description: oxidoreductase activity, acting on paired donors, with incorporation or reduction of molecular oxygen, reduced flavin or flavoprotein as one donor, and incorporation of one atom of oxygen
